title: The oracle concerning Dumah. One is calling to me from Seir, ‘Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?
The Israelites said to Isaiah, “O our Rabbi, Isaiah, what will come for us out of this night?
Wait for me, until I can present the question
Watchman, what of the night? What did the Guardian of the ages tell you?” O. He said to them, “The watchman says: ‘Morning comes; and also the night. If you will inquire, inquire; come back again
Also the night?” Q. He said to them, “It is not what you are thinking. But there will be morning for the righteous, and night for the wicked, morning for Israel, and night for idolaters
When?
Whenever you want, He too wants [it to be]—if you want it, he wants it
What is standing in the way?
